Definition: The highest year of primary or secondary education a parent/guardian/carer has completed.

SIF.Definition: The highest level of education completed by the contact person.

OtherStandards.Definition: Parental school education’ is the highest year of primary or secondary education a parent/guardian/carer has completed.
OtherStandards.Commentary: Parent/guardian/carers should retain their original designations as Parent 1 and Parent 2 for the duration of the student’s enrolment and upon enrolment of siblings with the same parents at the school unless there is a change of circumstances. Values: 4=Year 12 or equivalent, 3=Year 11 or equivalent, 2=Year 10 or equivalent, 1=Year 9 or equivalent or below, 0=Not Stated/Unknown.

Collections.Name: NAPLAN Student Registration
Collections.Commentary: The highest level of school education completed by Parent1/Parent2.

CrossrefEntities: Parent Main Language Other than English
